page.title: 09TRAFFIC IN SPETISBURY & C.M.
page.content: A major trunk road, the A35O, passes through both Spetisbury and Charlton Marshall. This links Poole to the Bristol area and West Midlands. As well as holiday traffic during the summer, an expansion of the container port at Poole has increased the number of large lorries. Recent road improvements such as the Wimborne and Blandford bypasses also seem to have increased use of the A35O. Dorset County Council considered using a disused railway line, which runs parallel to the road, as a means of bypassing both villages. This was dropped from the Dorset Structure Plan when residents living close to the railway line objected. There is a bus service to Blandford and Wimborne and Bournemouth, with two buses a day direct to Poole. Most families find a car essential.
